currency.description: The first series of coins of Republic India was introduced in 1950. These coins featured the Lion Capital of Ashoka and were minted in denominations of 1 pice to 1 rupee.

currency.name: 1 Anna Coin
currency.description: The Anna was a currency unit formerly used in British India. 16 annas made one rupee. The anna continued to be used until decimalization in 1957.

currency.name: Government of India Note
currency.description: Early notes from the 1950s featured the Ashoka Lion Capital. These notes were larger in size compared to modern currency and featured intricate designs.

music.title: Awaara Hoon
music.description: An iconic song from the film 'Awaara', composed by Shankar Jaikishan and sung by Mukesh. It became an anthem of the common man in post-independent India.

music.title: Pyar Hua Ikrar Hua
music.description: A romantic duet from 'Shree 420' that captured the essence of love in the 1950s. The umbrella scene became one of the most iconic moments in Indian cinema.

music.title: Mera Joota Hai Japani
music.description: A patriotic song from 'Shree 420' that symbolized the blend of Western influence with Indian values and national identity in the post-independence era.

music.title: Ajeeb Dastan Hai Yeh
music.description: A melancholic song from 'Dil Apna Aur Preet Parai' that showcases the golden era of Indian film music with its poetic lyrics and haunting melody.

newspapers.name: The Times of India
newspapers.headline: India Becomes Republic
newspapers.description: Historic front page announcing India's transition to a Republic as the Constitution came into effect, with Dr. Rajendra Prasad taking oath as the first President.

newspapers.name: The Hindustan Times
newspapers.headline: First Five Year Plan Announced
newspapers.description: Coverage of India's first Five-Year Plan (1951-1956) which focused on agricultural development to combat food crises and build economic self-sufficiency.

newspapers.name: The Hindu
newspapers.headline: India's First General Elections Begin
newspapers.description: Front page covering the world's largest democratic exercise as India held its first general elections, featuring 176 million voters across the nation.

food.name: Traditional Indian Thali
food.description: The typical 1950s Indian meal featured regional specialties with an emphasis on locally grown produce and traditional preparation methods.
